extendedIngredients.name: green onions
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup chopped green onions (white and pale green parts only)

title: Perfectly Poached Shrimp with Green Goddess Sauce
summary: Perfectly Poached Shrimp with Green Goddess Sauce might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 20 servings with 249 calories, 19g of protein, and 18g of fat each. For $2.17 per serving, this recipe covers 14% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. A mixture of tarragon, garlic clove, rice vinegar, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the coarse kosher salt you could follow this main course with the Salty Sweet Granolan and Coconut Yogurt {Sugar Rush Gift Edition #4} as a dessert. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is brought to you by Epicurious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. With a spoonacular score of 35%, this dish is not so amazing. Similar recipes include Shrimp with Green Goddess Sauce, Poached Salmon with Green Goddess Dressing, and Poached Salmon with Lima Beans and Green Goddess Dressing.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio. It has 4.8 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 15 dollars.

productMatches.title: GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: GIFFT Pinot Grigio bursts with lively pear and tropical fruits, balanced by crisp acidity and an elegantly refined freshness. Featuring ripe stone fruit and citrus aromas, this wine showcases melon, nectarine and Meyer lemon flavors that finish light and refreshing.

instructions: Preparation                                        For sauce:                Finely chop garlic in food processor. Add all remaining ingredients; blend until smooth and pale green. Season sauce to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer sauce to serving bowl. Cover and refrigerate until cold. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead. Keep refrigerated.)                                                            For shrimp:                Fill 2 large bowls with ice water; set aside. Bring very large pot of water to boil over high heat. Add 1/2 cup coarse salt to boiling water; return to boil. Rub shrimp in another large bowl with remaining 1/4 cup salt. Add shrimp to boiling salted water and cook just until cooked through, about 3 minutes (water will not return to boil). Immediately drain shrimp in colander, then quickly divide between prepared bowls of ice water; cool completely. Drain well. Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails intact. Arrange shrimp on platter. (Can be made 4 hours ahead. Cover and refrigerate.) Serve shrimp with sauce.

steps.step: Finely chop garlic in food processor.
Add all remaining ingredients; blend until smooth and pale green. Season sauce to taste with salt and pepper.
Transfer sauce to serving bowl. Cover and refrigerate until cold. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead. Keep refrigerated.)
Fill 2 large bowls with ice water; set aside. Bring very large pot of water to boil over high heat.
Add 1/2 cup coarse salt to boiling water; return to boil. Rub shrimp in another large bowl with remaining 1/4 cup salt.

Add shrimp to boiling salted water and cook just until cooked through, about 3 minutes (water will not return to boil). Immediately drain shrimp in colander, then quickly divide between prepared bowls of ice water; cool completely.
Drain well. Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails intact. Arrange shrimp on platter. (Can be made 4 hours ahead. Cover and refrigerate.)
